name: Arugula Salad with Dates
directions:
Ingredients:
2 bunches Arugula
8 Dates, sliced
1/4 cup chopped Almonds
1/3 cup Parmegiano chunks
1 tbsp Balsamic Vinegar
1 tsp Dijon Mustard
1/4 tsp Kosher Salt
1/8 tsp Black Pepper
3 tbsp Olive Oil

Directions:
In a large bowl, combine arugula, dates, almonds, and parmegiano. In a small bowl, pour olive oil, vinegar, mustard, salt and pepper. Whisk until combined. Add the dressing to the salad, and enjoy!

name: Buffalo Chicken Dip
directions:
Ingredients:
1 large can of chicken (shred with fork)
8 oz cream cheese
8 oz spicy ranch dressing
3 cups shredded cheddar cheese
8 oz buffalo wing hot sauce

Directions:
Stir together. Bake in oven 30-35 minutes at 350 degrees

Source: Erin Paukert

name: Chicken Liver Crostini
directions: Ingredients 3 tablespoons unsalted butter 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil 1 medium red onion, finely chopped 1/2 pound chicken livers, trimmed and patted dry 1/4 to 1/2 teaspoon hot red-pepper flakes 3 tablespoons capers, rinsed and coarsely chopped 1/2 cup sweet (red) vermouth 1 cup chopped parsley 1 sourdough baguette, thinly sliced and toasted 1 lemon wedge Preparation Heat butter and oil in a 12-inch heavy skillet over medium heat until foam subsides, then cook onion, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 3 minutes. Add livers and cook over medium-high heat until undersides are browned, about 3 minutes. Turn livers over and add red-pepper flakes, capers, and 1 teaspoon salt. Cook until livers are just cooked through, 5 to 7 minutes more. Increase heat to high and add vermouth. Boil, stirring, until slightly thickened and glossy, about 3 minutes. Transfer livers with a slotted spoon to a cutting board, then transfer sauce to a bowl. Coarsely chop livers and add to sauce. Season with salt and pepper and gently stir in parsley. Spoon onto toasts and squeeze a little lemon juice over each. Cooks\\\' notes: Liver mixture, without parsley, can be made 1 day ahead and chilled. Reheat, then stir in parsley, before spreading on toasts. Source: Gourmet January 2009, by Toni Oltranti

name: Eggplant and Tomato Caponata with Feta
directions:
3 Tbsp olive oil
2 eggplants, peeled and diced
1 garlic clove, minced
6 Roma tomatoes, peeled, seeded, diced
1 red onion, minced
Â¼ cup capers, rinsed and drained
Â¼ cup Italian parsley, chopped
salt and pepper to taste
1 package pita bread
 1.4 cup olive oil
4 ounces crumbled feta cheese

In a large sautÃ© pan over medium heat add the olive oil. When the oil is hot add the eggplant and sautÃ© for two to three minutes. Add the garlic and cool until the eggplant is soft. Remove the eggplant from the heat and allow it to cool. Add the Roma tomatoes, red onions, capers, parsley, and season with salt and pepper.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees FR. Cut pita into wedges and split into two pieces and brush with olive oil. Season with salt and pepper. Bake for 7 to 10 minutes until golden brown.

Lay the pita chips on a sheet tray and top with a spoonful of the caponata and follow with a small spoonful and the feta cheese.

Serves 12

Source: Robert Mondavi Winery, Napa Valley, CA

name: Flatbread Stuffed with Cheese and Prosciutto (Torta al Testo)
directions: Ingredients 1/4 ounce fresh (cake) yeast or 1 3/4 teaspoons active dry yeast 2/3 cup warm water (105-115 degrees F), divided 9 ounce unbleached bread flour (about 1 3/4 cups plus 2 tablespoons) 3/4 teaspoon salt 1/2 tablespoon olive oil 1/4 pound thinly sliced Italian Fontina, Gruyere, Parmesean or Emmental cheese 2 cups baby arugula 6 thin prosciutto slices Stir together yeast and 1/3 cup warm water in a small bowl and let stand until foamy, about 5 minutes. (If mixture doesn't foam, start over with new yeast.) Stir together flour and salt with a fork in a large bowl. Make a well in center and add yeast mixture and oil. Stir in flour, then stir in as much of remaining 1/3 cup water as needed to form a firm, moist dough. Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth, shiny, and elastic, about 10 minutes. Put dough in cleaned large bowl and cover bowl. Let rise in a draft-free place at warm room temperature until doubled, about 1 hour. Punch down dough and divide into 2 pieces. Form each piece into a ball and let stand, covered, 10 minutes. Roll out each ball on a lightly floured surface with a rolling pin into an 8-inch round (about 1/4 inch thick; if dough resists rolling out, let stand 1 to 2 minutes, then continue). Preheat oven to 400F with rack in middle. Heat a heavy medium skillet or griddle over medium-low heat until very hot, about 10 minutes. Cook rounds 1 at a time, flipping frequently to avoid scorching and to aid even cooking, until golden, about 6 minutes per round. Stack rounds and wrap in a kitchen towel (not terry cloth) to keep soft while cooling. When rounds are cool, separate into halves by cutting into bread all around edge and gently pulling rounds apart. Sandwich cheese, arugula, prosciutto, and salt and pepper to taste between halves. Put stuffed breads on a baking sheet and bake until crisp and cheese has melted, about 8 minutes. Serve warm. Cooks' note: Bread can be cooked (but not stuffed and baked) 2 hours ahead and kept wrapped in a kitchen towel. Makes 2 sandwiches Source: Gourmet, April 2008 by Ursula Ferrigno; www.epicurious.com
description: These easy sandwiches would make a great lunch or light dinner during the summer. I usually use Parmesan for the cheese. As with most meals with few ingredients, the quality of the products is very important. Try to buy the prosciutto from a place that sells the real thing and ask for it sliced very thin. The stuff sold in most grocery stores is too salty and isn't very good.

name: Melon and Mint
directions:
1 Honeydew melon
1/4 bunch of spearmint

Cut melon in half and remove seeds. Using a small scoop (3/4 diameter), spoon out balls of melon and set to side. When entire melon has been scooped out, fill each half with the melon balls.

Destem mint leaves. Finely chop up leaves and sprinkle on top of melon halves.

Serve.
description: Nice summer appetizer or dessert. Very refreshing.

name: Pizza Dip
directions:
Ingredients:

1 8 ounce package cream cheese, softened
1 15 ounce can tomato sauce
1/4 pound pepperoni slices, sliced into quarters
1 1/2 cups shredded mozzarella cheese

Directions:

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Spread cream cheese on the bottom of the pie pan. Pour pizza sauce over the cream cheese, and spread it so that there is an even layer of sauce. Layer pepperoni on top of tomato sauce. Top with mozzarella cheese.

Bake at 400 degrees for 20 to 25 minutes.
